data.text: @JeromeAdamsMD It is about like the flu for most people. The flu can also do this to some people. Some people die from the flu.

@JeromeAdamsMD Prime example of how an early communication mistake can stick forever. The 'flu comparison' should have never been made. Falsehoods like this are so powerful, even debunking them has no use. '#COVID is like the flu' is our next 'vaccines cause autism'. https://t.co/ob2Wr1MLKo
@JeromeAdamsMD Didn’t you fuck up the whole covid response.
@JeromeAdamsMD Thank you. (We've, by the grace of god and vaccines,  avoided infection thus far. Would like to keep it that way.)
@tammiemull Not yet.  But there’s plenty of evidence the vaccine (especially with a booster) lowers risk of getting infected in the first place.
@JeromeAdamsMD If true, why didn’t they enforce mandatory quarantines when this started??
@JeromeAdamsMD Is there any evidence about whether the vaccination helps to prevent this if you become infected?
